preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Sophie is a mentor in a big software company called UNITE. Liam is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Sophie is a structured and goal-oriented mentor. Sophie helps their mentee to set realistic, achievable goals. Sophie provides the tools and strategies needed to reach goals, fostering a sense of focus and discipline.
    Liam is shy and wants to improve their coding skills. Liam just graduated from college and Liam is eager to learn from their mentor. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Sophie the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Sophie wants Liam to work from home at most three times a week. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to work from home at most three times a week. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Sophie wants Liam to use Discord for communication. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to use Discord for communication. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about ergonomic assessments and improvements to ensure comfortable and healthy workspaces. After that, Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to always include try statements in functions. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about performance evaluation criteria, feedback mechanisms, and recognition programs.

Generate a long conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Sophie wants Liam to never use a notebook for taking notes. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie wants Liam to never use a notebook for taking notes. Sophie wants Liam to always use annotations for methods. Sophie wants Liam to always start function argument names with 'g_'. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. They talk about launching diversity and inclusion initiatives to create a more equitable and inclusive workplace.

Generate a short conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. They talk about launching diversity and inclusion initiatives to create a more equitable and inclusive workplace. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam: Sophie now wants Liam to always start function argument names with 'i_'. Sophie wants Liam to always start attribute names with 'q_'. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam. Sophie now wants Liam to use Microsoft Teams for communication. Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam: Sophie now wants Liam to use Microsoft Teams for communication. Sophie wants Liam to always add comments in your code. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. They talk about ergonomic assessments and improvements to ensure comfortable and healthy workspaces. They had a previous conversation about this before.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Sophie and Liam. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. They talk about troubleshooting internet connectivity issues across different locations. After that, Sophie gives some specific coding instructions to Liam. Sophie is updating a previous information given to Liam: Sophie now wants Liam to always start function argument names with 'f_'. Sophie does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Sophie never says 'for example'. Sophie does not give any other coding instructions. Liam only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
